articles.author: Betsy Klein, Kevin Liptak, Kaitlan Collins and Kate Sullivan, CNN
articles.title: Biden to join NATO leaders in Brussels and attend European Council summit next week amid Ukraine war - CNN
articles.description: President Joe Biden will travel to Europe next week to meet with world leaders and discuss Russia's invasion of Ukraine, White House press secretary Jen Psaki said Tuesday.

articles.title: Biden plans Europe trip for Ukraine summit next week as refugees top 3 million - Reuters.com
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will travel to Europe for an extraordinary NATO summit on Ukraine next week as the refugee tally from the invasion hit 3 million and Russian air strikes on Tuesday hit targets in Kyiv.
articles.content: LVIV, Ukraine/KYIV, March 15 (Reuters) - U.S. President Joe Biden will travel to Europe for an extraordinary NATO summit on Ukraine next week as the refugee tally from the invasion hit 3 million and … [+6724 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia holds 400 hospital patients and staff hostage in Mariupol, bombardment of Kyiv continues - ABC News
articles.description: In what's believed to be the biggest evacuation yet from Mariupol, about 2,000 cars make it out along the humanitarian corridor, while talks continue between Russia and Ukraine as European leaders head to Kyiv to show support.
articles.content:
Ukrainian officials say Russian forces have captured a hospital and taken patients and staff hostage in the besieged city of Mariupol. 
Key points:

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Biden to visit Europe for talks on Ukraine crisis - 9News
articles.description: US President Joe Biden will travel to Europe next week for face-to-face talks with European leaders about the Russian invasion of Ukraine, White House press secretary Jen Psaki announced this morning.

articles.title: Roman Abramovich sanctioned by European Union as Chelsea withdraw request to play FA Cup game at Middlesbrough behind closed doors - Sky Sports
articles.description: The European Union has imposed sanctions on Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich in new measures targeting Russia.
articles.content:

articles.title: European leaders visit Kyiv, Zelenskyy hints at compromise to stay outside Nato - Times of India

articles.author: Brenda Goodman and Deidre McPhillips, CNN
articles.title: What rising Covid-19 infections in the UK and Europe could mean for the US - CNN
articles.description: Two weeks after the United Kingdom dropped its last remaining Covid-19 mitigation measure -- a requirement that people who test positive for the virus isolate for five days -- the country is seeing cases and hospitalizations climb once again.

articles.author: Charlie Weston
articles.title: After years of cuts, mortgage rates now on the way up - Independent.ie
articles.description: The warning signs have been there for a while that mortgage lending rates were about to rise. Central banks around the world, including the European Central Bank, have been indicating that they will increase their key lending rates for banks.

articles.title: EU member states agree new package of sanctions against Russia - The Star Online
articles.description: (Reuters) -European Union member states have agreed on a fourth package of sanctions against Russia following its invasion of Ukraine, the office of the French EU presidency wrote on Twitter on Monday.
